trans-unit.source: Invoice by Part Invoice

seg-source.mrk: Invoice by Part Invoice

trans-unit.source: When invoicing by part invoices, the Cumulative Invoicing model is used. With this model, partial invoices are created for measurements as they occur during the construction process. These invoices contain the measurement quantity, not the sales order quantity. This is done so that the original Sales Order quantities are not modified. Partial invoices are sent to the customer with either adjustments for cumulative invoices and payment, or just payments.

seg-source.mrk: When invoicing by part invoices, the Cumulative Invoicing model is used.
With this model, partial invoices are created for measurements as they occur during the construction process.
These invoices contain the measurement quantity, not the sales order quantity.
This is done so that the original Sales Order quantities are not modified.
Partial invoices are sent to the customer with either adjustments for cumulative invoices and payment, or just payments.

trans-unit.source: For each new partial invoice, the previous partial invoices are moved back into the new partial invoice for internal accounting adjustments.

seg-source.mrk: For each new partial invoice, the previous partial invoices are moved back into the new partial invoice for internal accounting adjustments.

trans-unit.source: Once the Construction process is complete, measurement quantities are taken over to the order quantities, previous partial invoice is moved back into the sales order and a single line is added to the end of the sales order with a negative quantity and amount to offset the measurement changes.

seg-source.mrk: Once the Construction process is complete, measurement quantities are taken over to the order quantities, previous partial invoice is moved back into the sales order and a single line is added to the end of the sales order with a negative quantity and amount to offset the measurement changes.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites

seg-source.mrk: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before creating the invoice, the following settings must be done:

seg-source.mrk: Before creating the invoice, the following settings must be done:

trans-unit.source: Job Card, Invoice Model = Cumulative Invoicing

seg-source.mrk: Job Card, Invoice Model = Cumulative Invoicing

trans-unit.source: BoQ Budget Calculation = Sales Code must have Posting by = Sales Order

seg-source.mrk: BoQ Budget Calculation = Sales Code must have Posting by = Sales Order

trans-unit.source: Registered Measurement has been created and confirmed

seg-source.mrk: Registered Measurement has been created and confirmed

trans-unit.source: Report Selections Sales = Invoice set to report 5292686

trans-unit.source: Open the Sales Order

seg-source.mrk: Open the Sales Order

trans-unit.source: When it is time to post an order with measurements, open the Job Card and click the value in the Orders field of the Project Information FactBox.

seg-source.mrk: When it is time to post an order with measurements, open the Job Card and click the value in the Orders field of the Project Information FactBox.

trans-unit.source: : Opening the Sales Order from the Job Card

seg-source.mrk: : Opening the Sales Order from the Job Card

trans-unit.source: In the Sales Orders list page, click Edit. The Sales Order opens with Job positions, registered measurement values (as confirmed in section “Registered Measurement Documents” on page 1) and proper invoice settings in the Construction Invoicing FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: In the Sales Orders list page, click Edit.

The Sales Order opens with Job positions, registered measurement values (as confirmed in section “Registered Measurement Documents” on page 1) and proper invoice settings in the Construction Invoicing FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: : Sales Order with positions and registered measurements

trans-unit.source: Create Part Invoice

seg-source.mrk: Create Part Invoice

trans-unit.source: The partial invoice is created based on registered measurements in the Sales Order lines. Click Navigate > Create Part Invoice. A message appears asking to create the partial invoice.

seg-source.mrk: The partial invoice is created based on registered measurements in the Sales Order lines.
Click Navigate > Create Part Invoice.
A message appears asking to create the partial invoice.

trans-unit.source: : Message to create a partial invoice

seg-source.mrk: : Message to create a partial invoice

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to create the partial invoice, No to stop the creation process. The Sales Invoice opens.

seg-source.mrk: Click Yes to create the partial invoice, No to stop the creation process.
The Sales Invoice opens.

trans-unit.source: : Partial Sales Invoice for registered measurements

trans-unit.source: Also note that the Measurement Summary Code field is populated in the Construction Invoicing FastTab. Click Navigate > Measurement Summary to view the summary document that will be used for printing.

Click Navigate > Measurement Summary to view the summary document that will be used for printing.

trans-unit.source: Add Construction Charges to Invoice

seg-source.mrk: Add Construction Charges to Invoice

trans-unit.source: Depending on customer agreements, special calculations can be entered now for the invoice. Since the template was assigned to the job, the Invoicing document is copied automatically when the “CS Invoice Calculation” function is run. On the Navigate tab, click CS Invoice Calculation. The CS Invoicings page opens.

seg-source.mrk: Depending on customer agreements, special calculations can be entered now for the invoice.
Since the template was assigned to the job, the Invoicing document is copied automatically when the “CS Invoice Calculation” function is run.
On the Navigate tab, click CS Invoice Calculation.
The CS Invoicings page opens.

seg-source.mrk: : Calculation Value Transfer page with calculated values

trans-unit.source: Charges (in the top of the page) can be transferred below any selected line in the Transfer to Line(s) FastTab but are typically added to the end of the invoice. To transfer both charges to the end of the invoice, select both charges and then select the last line in the Transfer to Line(s) FastTab.

seg-source.mrk: Charges (in the top of the page) can be transferred below any selected line in the Transfer to Line(s) FastTab but are typically added to the end of the invoice.
To transfer both charges to the end of the invoice, select both charges and then select the last line in the Transfer to Line(s) FastTab.

trans-unit.source: Add New Measurements

seg-source.mrk: Add New Measurements

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, invoices are created through the construction process for all measurements until all positions have been invoiced. This section shows how to add measurements.

seg-source.mrk: As previously stated, invoices are created through the construction process for all measurements until all positions have been invoiced.
This section shows how to add measurements.

trans-unit.source: In the Sales Order, click Home > Measurement Document. A message appears asking to insert the complete BoQ in the measurement document.

seg-source.mrk: In the Sales Order, click Home > Measurement Document.
A message appears asking to insert the complete BoQ in the measurement document.

trans-unit.source: : Creating a new Measurement Document for the sales order

seg-source.mrk: : Creating a new Measurement Document for the sales order

A new Measurement Recording Card opens.

trans-unit.source: The process of updating the Measurement Recording Card is the same as described in topic .

and Measurement Location fields, being sure to update the lines as well.

trans-unit.source: : Measurement fields updated in header and lines

seg-source.mrk: : Measurement fields updated in header and lines

trans-unit.source: In the Lines FastTab, enter the measured quantities in the Quantity field. If any new measurements were taken on registered quantities, the Cum. Quantity field will show the cumulative total. For example, three lines have registered quantities (4, 4, and 7, respectively). New totals are entered for all three lines (5, 4, and 6, respectively) and the Cum. Quantity field shows the cumulative total of the new Quantity and Cum. Registered Quantity (9, 8, and 13, respectively).

seg-source.mrk: In the Lines FastTab, enter the measured quantities in the Quantity field.
If any new measurements were taken on registered quantities, the <span class="Bold">Cum.
Quantity field will show the cumulative total.
For example, three lines have registered quantities (4, 4, and 7, respectively).
New totals are entered for all three lines (5, 4, and 6, respectively) and the <span class="Bold">Cum.
Quantity field shows the cumulative total of the new Quantity and Cum.
Registered Quantity (9, 8, and 13, respectively).

trans-unit.source: : New measurements added for registered positions and new positions

The Measurement Recording Card closes.

trans-unit.source: In the Lines FastTab, enter the measured quantities in the Quantity field. Since this is the last invoice, all open positions should have registered measurements or new measurements. For example, the first four positions have new quantities, the next three positions have registered quantities, and the last four have new and registered quantities. Notice that a new measurement was not entered for position 3. 1. 70., which means the final measurement quantity is less than the order quantity. This will be handled in the Take over Measurement process in the Sales Order.

seg-source.mrk: In the Lines FastTab, enter the measured quantities in the Quantity field.
Since this is the last invoice, all open positions should have registered measurements or new measurements.
For example, the first four positions have new quantities, the next three positions have registered quantities, and the last four have new and registered quantities.
Notice that a new measurement was not entered for position 3.
1. 70., which means the final measurement quantity is less than the order quantity.
This will be handled in the Take over Measurement process in the Sales Order.

seg-source.mrk: Post Sales Order and Print Document with Past Invoices

trans-unit.source: Click Home > Post to ship and invoice the sales order. After posting, click Yes to open the Posted Sales Invoice. The Construction Invoicing FastTab displays related construction information.

seg-source.mrk: Click Home > Post to ship and invoice the sales order.
After posting, click Yes to open the Posted Sales Invoice.
The Construction Invoicing FastTab displays related construction information.

trans-unit.source: Click Actions > Print to open the Sales - Invoice dialog (for report 5292686). The Saved Settings FastTab appears indicating that the last used options and filters have been set.

seg-source.mrk: Click Actions > Print to open the Sales - Invoice dialog (for report 5292686).
The Saved Settings FastTab appears indicating that the last used options and filters have been set.

trans-unit.source: : Sales - Invoice print dialog with Saved Settings FastTab

seg-source.mrk: : Sales - Invoice print dialog with Saved Settings FastTab

trans-unit.source: Click Print to generate a document or Preview to view the document. The Sales Invoice document contains cumulative measurement information.

seg-source.mrk: Click Print to generate a document or Preview to view the document.
The Sales Invoice document contains cumulative measurement information.

trans-unit.source: : Sales Invoice with cumulative Measurements and Construction Charges (less partial invoices)

seg-source.mrk: : Sales Invoice with cumulative Measurements and Construction Charges (less partial invoices)

trans-unit.source: The Sales Order was deleted since it has been completely processed.

seg-source.mrk: The Sales Order was deleted since it has been completely processed.

trans-unit.source: Print Posted Sales Invoice without Past Invoices

seg-source.mrk: Print Posted Sales Invoice without Past Invoices

trans-unit.source: If none of the partial invoices have been paid by the customer, the Print Invoice/Payment History field can be set to Payments in the Sales - Invoice dialog.

seg-source.mrk: If none of the partial invoices have been paid by the customer, the Print Invoice/Payment History field can be set to Payments in the Sales - Invoice dialog.

trans-unit.source: : Sales - Invoice print dialog with Payments setting

seg-source.mrk: : Sales - Invoice print dialog with Payments setting

trans-unit.source: Using this setting will omit previous invoices and show any posted payments.

seg-source.mrk: Using this setting will omit previous invoices and show any posted payments.

trans-unit.source: : Sales Invoice without previous invoices and no posted payments

seg-source.mrk: : Sales Invoice without previous invoices and no posted payments
